column5:
Merge pull request #22 from titanous/fix-zombies

Wait on the child pid during the last step of Double

Wait on the child pid during the last step of Double

This avoids turning the child into a zombie.
Update README to reference new examples.
Support the old API in terms of the new one.
Rename strategies to Single and Double.

Progress: infinite loop.

I finally got the syscalls right.
Move cmd/goagain-example in preparation for more examples.

Merge pull request #17 from icub3d/master

Added the ability to call a user defined function for the SIGHUP and SIGUSR1 signals.
made name changes per rcrowley's request.
Added the ability to call a user defined function for the SIGHUP and SIGUSR1 signals.

Merge pull request #16 from NixM0nk3y/master

Fixup return statement warning on module install
Log but don't bail on Relaunch errors.  Closes #14.
Go can now handle SIGQUIT!  Closes #13.
Do the AcceptTCP() in the example
Add a missing import in the example

Example "just wait and see" strategy.

Closes #6 and #7.

It's very easy to stop listening and wait for in-flight requests to finish, so let's do that.
(#8) Support both TCP and UNIX domain sockets.

(#8) API change: s/*net.TCPListener/net.Listener/

This API change is necessary to support UNIX domain sockets seamlessly.
(#4, #5) Leave the listener at the same file descriptor.

Propagate the name of the file descriptor, too.

This always bothered me.

(#5) Now it only leaks one file descriptor.

But we paid a dear price: it's terrible to have to reflect into the net package.
Update to latest Go weekly with new signal handling.

Revert "Moving example back under cmd."

This reverts commit bfb76f9f14e59786acf7c0c2861419c149d3827a.
